wikipedia_page.main: James McCrorie Gourlay (1 November 1860 – 10 March 1939) was a Scottish footballer who played as a half back or forward.

response: James Gourlay (11 January 1888 – 12 September 1970)More double trouble: the two James Gourlays of Cambuslang, Scottish Sport History, 24 January 2014 was a Scottish footballer.

Gourlay played in the Home Scots v Anglo-Scots annual trial match in 1914Association Football.  International Trial Match., The Glasgow Herald, 17 March 1914 and was selected for the Scottish Football League XI either side of the war, but never gained a full international cap. His father James Gourlay played once for Scotland in 1888; they are related to the lawn bowls champions David Gourlay Sr. and David Gourlay Jr.

response: |align=left|The Scottish FA profile merges the statistics of James Gourlay (born 1860) and James Gourlay (born 1862) into a single profile.
James Gourlay is a British conductor.
*James Gourlay (footballer, born 1860) (1860–1939), Scottish international footballer in 1888, father of Jimmy Gourlay
*James Gourlay (footballer, born 1862) (1862–1926), Scottish international footballer in 1886
He is related to the Scottish footballers James Gourlay and Jimmy Gourlay.
He is related to the Scottish footballers James Gourlay and Jimmy Gourlay.
James Gourlay (30 October 1862 – 8 June 1926) was a Scottish footballer who played as an outside left.

Born in Cambuslang, Gourlay played club football for Cambuslang (appearing in the 1888 Scottish Cup Final)Scottish Cup Final Tie Renton V. Cambuslang, The Glasgow Herald, 6 February 1888Renton v Cambuslang 6-1, Scottish Football Association and made one appearance for Scotland against Ireland in 1886 (a 7–2 victory in which he scored the last goal).(Scotland player) James Gourlay, London Hearts Supporters Club He is often confused with another James Gourlay, also a Cambuslang player, who was capped for Scotland in 1888.

* James Gourlay, Jimmy Gourlay (son)More double trouble: the two James Gourlays of Cambuslang, Scottish Sport History, 24 January 2014James Gourlay's descendants David Gourlay Sr. and David Gourlay Jr. were international lawn bowls champions
